info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laurens, east central Greenville and west central Spartanburg Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown, or near Five Forks, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, Mauldin, Simpsonville, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Reidville, GSP Airport, Duncan and Greer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
